tips.title: Check Physical Connections
tips.description: Ensure all cables are securely connected to your router and device. Loose or damaged cables can cause intermittent connection issues.

tips.title: Restart Your Devices
tips.description: Try restarting your router and device to reset network settings. This can often resolve temporary connectivity issues.

tips.title: Update Network Drivers
tips.description: Make sure your network drivers are up to date. Outdated drivers can lead to compatibility issues and network instability.

tips.title: Check for Interference
tips.description: Avoid placing your router near electronic devices or appliances that emit electromagnetic interference, such as microwaves or cordless phones.

tips.title: Contact Your Internet Service Provider
tips.description: If the problem persists, contact your ISP to check for any network outages or issues in your area. They can also provide further troubleshooting assistance.
